Job Description:
The Opportunity: Family Law Attorney/Lawyer
Are you a passionate, licensed attorney/lawyer in the market for a new opportunity that pays dividends? At Marble, we believe that everyone, everywhere deserves access to remarkable legal care, so we’re changing the way legal services work.
What does that mean for you? As a Marble attorney/lawyer, you can:
Expand your practice—take on as many or as few cases as you’d like per month.
Earn more—The more cases you take, the more you earn (upward of $10,000 a month).
Work from wherever you are—we’re powered by cutting-edge tech and this is a predominantly remote opportunity.
Focus on what you love—we handle administrative tasks like collections and marketing services so you can prioritize practicing law.

This is primarily a work-from-your-home-office role. We have been a work-from-home business for 20 years!
Outside GC offers a compelling alternative to a traditional law firm or in-house career. Our attorneys have tremendous flexibility representing fast-growth and large established companies, including many hundreds of early-stage companies to dozens of internationally recognized entities. We have a unique model that affords our attorneys both work-life balance and flexible, high quality legal engagements. Attorneys are not expected to source their own clients.

Job Title: Remote Of-Counsel Virginia Debt Settlement Attorney
Job Description:
Established national law firm focused on assisting consumer clients enrolled in debt resolution programs seeks a remote of-counsel (contract/freelance) attorney, licensed in the state of Virginia, to assist and represent clients in debt collection lawsuits. This position is ideal for a solo practitioner or part-time attorney looking to generate additional income, while retaining autonomy and flexible hours.
Responsibilities will include providing limited-scope assistance for pro-se clients or, for clients engaging the firm in a broader capacity, providing formal representation and negotiation oversight until the case has been settled. This position will rarely require complex litigation and/or attendance at final hearings, as clients are concurrently enrolled in debt settlement programs, and have retained our firm to assist in settling the cases through voluntary payment arrangements with the creditors. Where attendance at a hearing becomes necessary, the attorney will have the option of attending for additional pay or asking the firm to secure local coverage counsel.

Company Overview
Price Benowitz, LLP is a mid-sized law firm headquartered in Washington, DC with offices and attorneys throughout Washington, D.C., Maryland and Virginia. The firm handles many areas of law including criminal defense, personal injury, medical malpractice, immigration, trusts and estates, family, OFAC, business transactional and whistleblower law.
Our firm was built on the understanding that comprehensive representation does not begin and end in the courtroom. We know that just having sound legal counsel does not translate to a comprehensive and satisfactory experience for a client. We want our clients to be satisfied with their choice of firm, not just in their choice of attorney. Our client service and support staff are dedicated to making the experience of retaining an attorney as smooth as possible and ensuring that no client ever has a question or concern that goes unanswered. It doesn’t matter how good an attorney is if they don’t pay close attention to the wants and needs of the client. We want to make sure that each of our clients is as happy with the experience they have with our firm as they are with the ultimate result in his or her case.

Price Benowitz, LLP currently has an opening for a Personal Injury Attorney to join their personal injury/medical malpratice team. The attorney will be representing plaintiffs with injury and malpractice matters in the DC metropolitan area. This attorney will work directly with the head of the litigation department to ensure that our clients are provided the representation they deserve. We are committed to hiring attorneys that are passionate about helping people, have a 'no job too-big or too-small' mentality and understand that a person's experience with the firm does not begin and end in the court room. Price Benowitz invests in the success and growth of the firm by hiring staff that not only understand the law but also understand the real-world impact that people face when they are going through a legal matter. This is a perfect opportunity to join a firm with an established team of passionate individuals that are committed to upholding high standards of representation and customer service.

Some Task and Responsibilities:

At Freelance Legal EXchange (FLEX), we connect high-quality freelance and contract attorneys with law firms that need them. FLEX allows law firms of all sizes to access attorneys who can provide additional capacity to assist with a specific project, a higher than normal case load or to utilize the expertise of a specialized attorney, all without taking on the additional overhead and commitment of hiring a full-time attorney. Whether a law firm needs assistance with discovery, motion work, brief writing, legal research, deposition assistance, court appearances, trial preparation, or business law needs, law firms can turn to FLEX to find the exact type of freelance lawyer they need.
To join our network of freelance attorneys, email us your resume and tell us about your areas of interest/expertise. We will review your information and get back to you with next steps. And if you are looking for a full time position instead, we can help with that as well.
At the present time, we are focused on working with attorneys licensed in Louisiana. However, if you are licensed in other states, you can still send us your information so we can have it on file when we expand into other markets.

Job Title: Legal - Associate General Counsel - Human Resources (100% Remote - Must reside in CA)
Job Description:
JOB TITLE: Associate General Counsel
DEPARTMENT: Legal
STATUS: Exempt
JOB CODE: 10123
LOCATION: Remote *Must reside in California

GENERAL DESCRIPTION:
The Associate General Counsel/Human Resources primarily is responsible for implementing strategic legal initiatives throughout the Credit Union related to Human Resources. The incumbent supports the General Counsel in providing executive management with practical and effective advice on Human Resources-related legal strategies and implementation, including litigation and oversight of outside counsel. The Associate General Counsel/Human Resources also collaborates closely with Human Resources partners, business partners, and other Associate General Counsel employed by the Credit Union.

The Associate General Counsel/Human Resources works approximately 20-25 hours per week, and generally is available to work every day, Monday through Friday. However, as an exempt employee, the incumbent must be flexible regarding their weekly schedule and hours worked.

This position is 100% remote. However, the incumbent is required to attend on-site meetings at Golden 1’s headquarters in Sacramento and fully participate (i.e., audio and video) in Internet-based meetings as necessary and/or directed.


In collaboration with the General Counsel, the Associate General Counsel/Human Resources advises, consults, and educates Credit Union business partners on Human Resources-related legal issues to proactively promote employee well-being and reduce the Credit Union’s potential legal, governance and compliance risk exposure.


1. Assist in overseeing Human Resources-related legal matters, including workplace safety.
2. Collaborate and partner with Human Resources and related departments to provide timely, accurate, and practical legal counsel.
3. Manage Human Resources-related outside litigation.
4. Maintain a thorough understanding of state and federal workplace laws and regulations.
5. Foster a positive and engaging work environment by promoting skill development, coaching for improvement and growth, inspiring others through words and actions, ensuring positive employee morale throughout Golden 1, and embracing the Credit Union’s mission, vision and core values.
6. Assist in the direction of all Huma Resources-related Credit Union activities to ensure polices, structures, and procedures reflect best practices and comply with all federal and state regulatory requirements.
7. Keep apprised of changes in Human-Resources-related laws and regulations.
8. Assist in the supervision and monitoring of work performed by outside counsel, including litigation.
PHYSICAL SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND EXERTION UTILIZED IN THE PERFORMANCE OF THESE TASKS:
1. Effective oral and written communication skills required to oversee all corporate legal matters.
2. Sufficient manual dexterity to skillfully operate an on-line computer terminal and other standard office equipment, such as financial calculators, personal computer, facsimile machine and telephone.


All levels of staff and management.
External counsel, regulators, external auditors, administrative agencies, and courts.


Juris Doctorate from a law school accredited by the State Bar of California or the American Bar Association.
Minimum of three (3) years of experience practicing employment law, either in-house or with a law firm, preferably with a national or large regional law firm. Prior experience advising clients on California workplace laws strongly preferred.



1. Prolonged sitting throughout the workday with occasional mobility.
2. Corrected vision within the normal range.
3. Hearing within normal range, with or without the use of a device to enhance hearing.
4. Occasional overnight travel as required.


1. Active membership and good standing status with the State Bar of California.
2. Current valid license to practice in California.

At Freelance Legal EXchange (FLEX), we connect high-quality freelance and contract attorneys with law firms that need them. FLEX allows law firms of all sizes to access attorneys who can provide additional capacity to assist with a specific project, a higher than normal case load or to utilize the expertise of a specialized attorney, all without taking on the additional overhead and commitment of hiring a full-time attorney. Whether a law firm needs assistance with discovery, motion work, brief writing, legal research, deposition assistance, court appearances, trial preparation, or business law needs, law firms can turn to FLEX to find the exact type of freelance lawyer they need.
To join our network of freelance attorneys, email us your resume and tell us about your areas of interest/expertise. We will review your information and get back to you with next steps. And if you are looking for a full time position instead, we can help with that as well.
At the present time, we are focused on working with attorneys licensed in Louisiana. However, if you are licensed in other states, you can still send us your information so we can have it on file when we expand into other markets.

Job Title: Legal - Associate General Counsel - Human Resources (100% Remote - Must reside in CA)
Job Description:
JOB TITLE: Associate General Counsel
DEPARTMENT: Legal
STATUS: Exempt
JOB CODE: 10123
LOCATION: Remote *Must reside in California

GENERAL DESCRIPTION:
The Associate General Counsel/Human Resources primarily is responsible for implementing strategic legal initiatives throughout the Credit Union related to Human Resources. The incumbent supports the General Counsel in providing executive management with practical and effective advice on Human Resources-related legal strategies and implementation, including litigation and oversight of outside counsel. The Associate General Counsel/Human Resources also collaborates closely with Human Resources partners, business partners, and other Associate General Counsel employed by the Credit Union.

The Associate General Counsel/Human Resources works approximately 20-25 hours per week, and generally is available to work every day, Monday through Friday. However, as an exempt employee, the incumbent must be flexible regarding their weekly schedule and hours worked.

This position is 100% remote. However, the incumbent is required to attend on-site meetings at Golden 1’s headquarters in Sacramento and fully participate (i.e., audio and video) in Internet-based meetings as necessary and/or directed.


In collaboration with the General Counsel, the Associate General Counsel/Human Resources advises, consults, and educates Credit Union business partners on Human Resources-related legal issues to proactively promote employee well-being and reduce the Credit Union’s potential legal, governance and compliance risk exposure.


1. Assist in overseeing Human Resources-related legal matters, including workplace safety.
2. Collaborate and partner with Human Resources and related departments to provide timely, accurate, and practical legal counsel.
3. Manage Human Resources-related outside litigation.
4. Maintain a thorough understanding of state and federal workplace laws and regulations.
5. Foster a positive and engaging work environment by promoting skill development, coaching for improvement and growth, inspiring others through words and actions, ensuring positive employee morale throughout Golden 1, and embracing the Credit Union’s mission, vision and core values.
6. Assist in the direction of all Huma Resources-related Credit Union activities to ensure polices, structures, and procedures reflect best practices and comply with all federal and state regulatory requirements.
7. Keep apprised of changes in Human-Resources-related laws and regulations.
8. Assist in the supervision and monitoring of work performed by outside counsel, including litigation.
PHYSICAL SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND EXERTION UTILIZED IN THE PERFORMANCE OF THESE TASKS:
1. Effective oral and written communication skills required to oversee all corporate legal matters.
2. Sufficient manual dexterity to skillfully operate an on-line computer terminal and other standard office equipment, such as financial calculators, personal computer, facsimile machine and telephone.


All levels of staff and management.
External counsel, regulators, external auditors, administrative agencies, and courts.


Juris Doctorate from a law school accredited by the State Bar of California or the American Bar Association.
Minimum of three (3) years of experience practicing employment law, either in-house or with a law firm, preferably with a national or large regional law firm. Prior experience advising clients on California workplace laws strongly preferred.



1. Prolonged sitting throughout the workday with occasional mobility.
2. Corrected vision within the normal range.
3. Hearing within normal range, with or without the use of a device to enhance hearing.
4. Occasional overnight travel as required.


1. Active membership and good standing status with the State Bar of California.
2. Current valid license to practice in California.
#IND3

Furthermore you are responsible for negotiating with defendants and attorneys while at court, phone, e-mail, and regular mail to settle contested cases. You will also draft and file motions as well as responses to motions from defendants. You are required to provide your own reliable transportation to get to each court house, which will be across the state (mostly downstate). There will be extensive daily driving.
Primary Responsibilities:
Court Appearances – Associate is required to correctly prepare, appear timely, and properly handle court appearances in any downstate counties. It is your responsibility to ensure you are able to timely and reliably appear on time at the given courthouse. You may need to travel overnight for certain locations, driving a car is required for almost all locations.

Job Title: Remote Of-Counsel Virginia Debt Settlement Attorney
Job Description:
Established national law firm focused on assisting consumer clients enrolled in debt resolution programs seeks a remote of-counsel (contract/freelance) attorney, licensed in the state of Virginia, to assist and represent clients in debt collection lawsuits. This position is ideal for a solo practitioner or part-time attorney looking to generate additional income, while retaining autonomy and flexible hours.
Responsibilities will include providing limited-scope assistance for pro-se clients or, for clients engaging the firm in a broader capacity, providing formal representation and negotiation oversight until the case has been settled. This position will rarely require complex litigation and/or attendance at final hearings, as clients are concurrently enrolled in debt settlement programs, and have retained our firm to assist in settling the cases through voluntary payment arrangements with the creditors. Where attendance at a hearing becomes necessary, the attorney will have the option of attending for additional pay or asking the firm to secure local coverage counsel.

LITIGATION ASSOCIATE
Spencer LLP, a litigation boutique with strong local and national practices, seeks an associate attorney to assist with our complex litigation matters.
The ideal candidate is resourceful, clever, writes well, speaks well, and has good common sense. You will work as part of a team with others in the firm and with experts, local counsel, and clients. You will help work up cases by getting them ready to evaluate, mediate and try if need be. Personal initiative and attention to detail are crucial. You will need the stuff to handle tough opponents, tough experts, tough issues, and tough jurisdictions. You must have a high level of integrity and professional accountability.
This is an excellent opportunity for anyone who wants to work at the highest levels, get compensated accordingly, and take on exciting responsibilities.

Job Title: Legal - Associate General Counsel - Human Resources (100% Remote - Must reside in CA)
Job Description:
JOB TITLE: Associate General Counsel
DEPARTMENT: Legal
STATUS: Exempt
JOB CODE: 10123
LOCATION: Remote *Must reside in California

GENERAL DESCRIPTION:
The Associate General Counsel/Human Resources primarily is responsible for implementing strategic legal initiatives throughout the Credit Union related to Human Resources. The incumbent supports the General Counsel in providing executive management with practical and effective advice on Human Resources-related legal strategies and implementation, including litigation and oversight of outside counsel. The Associate General Counsel/Human Resources also collaborates closely with Human Resources partners, business partners, and other Associate General Counsel employed by the Credit Union.

The Associate General Counsel/Human Resources works approximately 20-25 hours per week, and generally is available to work every day, Monday through Friday. However, as an exempt employee, the incumbent must be flexible regarding their weekly schedule and hours worked.

This position is 100% remote. However, the incumbent is required to attend on-site meetings at Golden 1’s headquarters in Sacramento and fully participate (i.e., audio and video) in Internet-based meetings as necessary and/or directed.


In collaboration with the General Counsel, the Associate General Counsel/Human Resources advises, consults, and educates Credit Union business partners on Human Resources-related legal issues to proactively promote employee well-being and reduce the Credit Union’s potential legal, governance and compliance risk exposure.


1. Assist in overseeing Human Resources-related legal matters, including workplace safety.
2. Collaborate and partner with Human Resources and related departments to provide timely, accurate, and practical legal counsel.
3. Manage Human Resources-related outside litigation.
4. Maintain a thorough understanding of state and federal workplace laws and regulations.
5. Foster a positive and engaging work environment by promoting skill development, coaching for improvement and growth, inspiring others through words and actions, ensuring positive employee morale throughout Golden 1, and embracing the Credit Union’s mission, vision and core values.
6. Assist in the direction of all Huma Resources-related Credit Union activities to ensure polices, structures, and procedures reflect best practices and comply with all federal and state regulatory requirements.
7. Keep apprised of changes in Human-Resources-related laws and regulations.
8. Assist in the supervision and monitoring of work performed by outside counsel, including litigation.
PHYSICAL SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND EXERTION UTILIZED IN THE PERFORMANCE OF THESE TASKS:
1. Effective oral and written communication skills required to oversee all corporate legal matters.
2. Sufficient manual dexterity to skillfully operate an on-line computer terminal and other standard office equipment, such as financial calculators, personal computer, facsimile machine and telephone.


All levels of staff and management.
External counsel, regulators, external auditors, administrative agencies, and courts.


Juris Doctorate from a law school accredited by the State Bar of California or the American Bar Association.

Job Title: Remote Of-Counsel Virginia Debt Settlement Attorney
Job Description:
Established national law firm focused on assisting consumer clients enrolled in debt resolution programs seeks a remote of-counsel (contract/freelance) attorney, licensed in the state of Virginia, to assist and represent clients in debt collection lawsuits. This position is ideal for a solo practitioner or part-time attorney looking to generate additional income, while retaining autonomy and flexible hours.
Responsibilities will include providing limited-scope assistance for pro-se clients or, for clients engaging the firm in a broader capacity, providing formal representation and negotiation oversight until the case has been settled. Company Overview
Price Benowitz, LLP is a mid-sized law firm headquartered in Washington, DC with offices and attorneys throughout Washington, D.C., Maryland and Virginia. The firm handles many areas of law including criminal defense, personal injury, medical malpractice, immigration, trusts and estates, family, OFAC, business transactional and whistleblower law.
Our firm was built on the understanding that comprehensive representation does not begin and end in the courtroom. We know that just having sound legal counsel does not translate to a comprehensive and satisfactory experience for a client. We want our clients to be satisfied with their choice of firm, not just in their choice of attorney. Our client service and support staff are dedicated to making the experience of retaining an attorney as smooth as possible and ensuring that no client ever has a question or concern that goes unanswered. It doesn’t matter how good an attorney is if they don’t pay close attention to the wants and needs of the client. We want to make sure that each of our clients is as happy with the experience they have with our firm as they are with the ultimate result in his or her case.

We are committed to hiring attorneys that are passionate about helping people, have a 'no job too-big or too-small' mentality and understand that a person's experience with the firm does not begin and end in the court room. Price Benowitz invests in the success and growth of the firm by hiring staff that not only understand the law but also understand the real-world impact that people face when they are going through a legal matter. This is a perfect opportunity to join a firm with an established team of passionate individuals that are committed to upholding high standards of representation and customer service.

Job Title: Remote Of-Counsel Virginia Debt Settlement Attorney
Job Description:
Established national law firm focused on assisting consumer clients enrolled in debt resolution programs seeks a remote of-counsel (contract/freelance) attorney, licensed in the state of Virginia, to assist and represent clients in debt collection lawsuits. This position is ideal for a solo practitioner or part-time attorney looking to generate additional income, while retaining autonomy and flexible hours.
Responsibilities will include providing limited-scope assistance for pro-se clients or, for clients engaging the firm in a broader capacity, providing formal representation and negotiation oversight until the case has been settled. This position will rarely require complex litigation and/or attendance at final hearings, as clients are concurrently enrolled in debt settlement programs, and have retained our firm to assist in settling the cases through voluntary payment arrangements with the creditors. Where attendance at a hearing becomes necessary, the attorney will have the option of attending for additional pay or asking the firm to secure local coverage counsel.

Job description
Case Assessment Attorney (Remote)
Marble is looking for a case assessment attorney to help us meet the demand of incoming cases to ensure everyone has access to affordable legal care. This is a junior-level position with opportunities for advancement. This is a full-time, fully remote position, with flexible hours.
Your primary job responsibility is to perform the initial case consultation. You will be responsible for determining the scope of engagement and pricing based on Marble’s scale.
Qualifications
We are looking for attorneys who solely want to focus on providing our clients with advice and guidance on the best way to move their cases forward. You’ll be a team player who partners closely with our legal team in order to identify the client’s needs and get a strategy in place to set the clients up for success.

Labor & Employment Attorney/Lawyer
Marble is a human kind of law firm that combines remarkable legal care, transparency, and heart. By using predictive analytics to accurately price and predict each legal need, a collaboration platform for a faster and optimal case result, and digital communications, Marble makes the experience of getting quality legal care easy and affordable. Marble set out to make legal care more accessible for everyday people by building technology that empowers attorneys to do their best work, and that puts clients in control of the process from start to finish.
We are a fast-growing early-stage startup founded by a team of serial entrepreneurs and is backed by Silicon Valley VC funds.
Marble is looking for a licensed Attorney/Lawyer to begin taking Labor & Employment cases as co-counsel immediately, fully remote.

Divorce Lawyer for Women
Are you looking to finally put your law degree to use towards something you’d actually enjoy doing?
A position that allows you to make a difference in the lives of your clients?
A career a law firm that actually takes advantage of technology so that you can work remotely when possible, and around the schedule of your children and family?
If this describes you, we’d love you to consider joining the Bruce Law Firm for our open attorney position. We are a divorce and family law firm that focuses mostly on representing women who are married to controlling, manipulative, or narcissistic husbands.
We strive to focus our firm on these cases because we believe that our female clients in these relationships will actually benefit from their marriage being dissolved. If you want to get a better feel for the philosophy of how we approach helping our clients feel free to download a few of our free books at www.DivorceInformationBooks.com.

Creditor’s Rights law firm and has an position for an Associate Attorney in the Springfield, IL area who will be based out of their home. As an associate you are expected to appear on time to court 5 days per week in all downstate counties that are required each week. You are expected to review all the cases and prepare the relevant orders for each of those calls, trials and motions. Furthermore you are responsible for negotiating with defendants and attorneys while at court, phone, e-mail, and regular mail to settle contested cases. You will also draft and file motions as well as responses to motions from defendants. You are required to provide your own reliable transportation to get to each court house, which will be across the state (mostly downstate). There will be extensive daily driving.
Primary Responsibilities:
Court Appearances – Associate is required to correctly prepare, appear timely, and properly handle court appearances in any downstate counties. It is your responsibility to ensure you are able to timely and reliably appear on time at the given courthouse. You may need to travel overnight for certain locations, driving a car is required for almost all locations.

We know that just having sound legal counsel does not translate to a comprehensive and satisfactory experience for a client. We want our clients to be satisfied with their choice of firm, not just in their choice of attorney. Our client service and support staff are dedicated to making the experience of retaining an attorney as smooth as possible and ensuring that no client ever has a question or concern that goes unanswered. It doesn’t matter how good an attorney is if they don’t pay close attention to the wants and needs of the client. We want to make sure that each of our clients is as happy with the experience they have with our firm as they are with the ultimate result in his or her case.

Price Benowitz, LLP currently has an opening for a Personal Injury Attorney to join their personal injury/medical malpratice team. We are committed to hiring attorneys that are passionate about helping people, have a 'no job too-big or too-small' mentality and understand that a person's experience with the firm does not begin and end in the court room. Price Benowitz invests in the success and growth of the firm by hiring staff that not only understand the law but also understand the real-world impact that people face when they are going through a legal matter. This is a perfect opportunity to join a firm with an established team of passionate individuals that are committed to upholding high standards of representation and customer service.

Job Title: Junior Attorney to Join Collegial, Entrepreneurial, Socially-Conscious Firm
Job Description:
Please include a brief cover letter to let us know why you are interested. Applications without cover letters will not be considered. You can include the cover letter with your resume or send it directly to Mark Lyda (email on website).
Remember why you went to law school? We do too! We have been building a firm to help you preserve those ideals. Our mission is to increase access to high-quality legal services for small businesses and moderate-income individuals.
This job is for an attorney (can be a new attorney) to join our main office in Denver. We are still working remotely. You will be working under the supervision of our positive and collegial team.
Our firm is not for everyone; but for some, we are a unique fit. We compensate purely through revenue sharing, and our firm culture is different from a typical law firm. We are looking for someone entrepreneurial - we will help you develop business, but we expect our attorneys to take a proactive role in building their clientele.

Job Title: Remote Of-Counsel Virginia Debt Settlement Attorney
Job Description:
Established national law firm focused on assisting consumer clients enrolled in debt resolution programs seeks a remote of-counsel (contract/freelance) attorney, licensed in the state of Virginia, to assist and represent clients in debt collection lawsuits. This position is ideal for a solo practitioner or part-time attorney looking to generate additional income, while retaining autonomy and flexible hours.
Responsibilities will include providing limited-scope assistance for pro-se clients or, for clients engaging the firm in a broader capacity, providing formal representation and negotiation oversight until the case has been settled. This position will rarely require complex litigation and/or attendance at final hearings, as clients are concurrently enrolled in debt settlement programs, and have retained our firm to assist in settling the cases through voluntary payment arrangements with the creditors. Where attendance at a hearing becomes necessary, the attorney will have the option of attending for additional pay or asking the firm to secure local coverage counsel.

Job description
Case Assessment Attorney (Remote)
Marble is looking for a case assessment attorney to help us meet the demand of incoming cases to ensure everyone has access to affordable legal care. This is a junior-level position with opportunities for advancement. This is a full-time, fully remote position, with flexible hours.
Your primary job responsibility is to perform the initial case consultation. You will be responsible for determining the scope of engagement and pricing based on Marble’s scale.
Qualifications
We are looking for attorneys who solely want to focus on providing our clients with advice and guidance on the best way to move their cases forward. You’ll be a team player who partners closely with our legal team in order to identify the client’s needs and get a strategy in place to set the clients up for success.

Needed Immediately - Experienced attorney proficient in the Securities Act of 1933 offer, sale and registration statement requirements, including registration on Forms S-1, S-3, S-4 and S-8. Applicants must have experience with a complete IPO process and Form S-3 takedown transactions, including Registered Direct, CMPO and ATM Offerings, and be able to prepare all needed transaction documents including the ProSupp. Applicants must be knowledgeable and experienced with Rule 424 requirements. Work will also include Regulation A Offerings. Attorneys may work remote. The ability to consistently produce a high-quality work product and a strong work ethic are the key considerations. Qualified candidates will receive above market compensation consistent with or above AmLaw 200 pay rates.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $250,000.00 - $500,000.00 per year

Labor & Employment Attorney/Lawyer
Marble is a human kind of law firm that combines remarkable legal care, transparency, and heart. By using predictive analytics to accurately price and predict each legal need, a collaboration platform for a faster and optimal case result, and digital communications, Marble makes the experience of getting quality legal care easy and affordable. Marble set out to make legal care more accessible for everyday people by building technology that empowers attorneys to do their best work, and that puts clients in control of the process from start to finish.
We are a fast-growing early-stage startup founded by a team of serial entrepreneurs and is backed by Silicon Valley VC funds.
Marble is looking for a licensed Attorney/Lawyer to begin taking Labor & Employment cases as co-counsel immediately, fully remote.

Creditor’s Rights law firm and has an position for an Associate Attorney in the Springfield, IL area who will be based out of their home. As an associate you are expected to appear on time to court 5 days per week in all downstate counties that are required each week. You are expected to review all the cases and prepare the relevant orders for each of those calls, trials and motions. Furthermore you are responsible for negotiating with defendants and attorneys while at court, phone, e-mail, and regular mail to settle contested cases. You will also draft and file motions as well as responses to motions from defendants. You are required to provide your own reliable transportation to get to each court house, which will be across the state (mostly downstate). There will be extensive daily driving.
Primary Responsibilities:
Court Appearances – Associate is required to correctly prepare, appear timely, and properly handle court appearances in any downstate counties. It is your responsibility to ensure you are able to timely and reliably appear on time at the given courthouse. You may need to travel overnight for certain locations, driving a car is required for almost all locations.

Our consumer law firm is in search of an experienced attorney licensed in Hawaii to join our team. This is a contract position, so the ideal candidate should either have their own practice already, or be looking to supplement their current income with additional work.
This is a work from home position that requires you to communicate with clients, managing attorneys, and legal support staff remotely -- so a strong understanding of technology is crucial. The ideal candidate should be able to work autonomously with limited supervision, be comfortable managing a high-volume caseload, and have the ability to work a case from inception through to trial/settlement. Excellent organizational & time-management skills are necessary in order to meet strict court deadlines.
Compensation is competitive and commensurate with experience. Please submit a formatted resume for consideration.

A statewide law firm seeks an attorney to serve family and criminal law clients in any of several Oklahoma counties. Work from existing offices or build out a new location.

Whether you know your way around the courts or you want to develop practical skills, we have the resources you need to make your law practice rewarding for you and for your clients.

Burford & Ryburn, L.L.P. is seeking an energetic and dedicated associate attorney with 1 – 3 years of experience in civil defense litigation to join our law firm team. You’ll work on a variety of cases and ensure the needs of our clients are always placed as our top priority.

LITIGATION ASSOCIATE
Spencer LLP, a litigation boutique with strong local and national practices, seeks an associate attorney to assist with our complex litigation matters.
The ideal candidate is resourceful, clever, writes well, speaks well, and has good common sense. You will work as part of a team with others in the firm and with experts, local counsel, and clients. You will help work up cases by getting them ready to evaluate, mediate and try if need be. Personal initiative and attention to detail are crucial. You will need the stuff to handle tough opponents, tough experts, tough issues, and tough jurisdictions. You must have a high level of integrity and professional accountability.
This is an excellent opportunity for anyone who wants to work at the highest levels, get compensated accordingly, and take on exciting responsibilities.

Segal McCambridge, a national litigation firm, is seeking an Associate Attorney for our Chicago office. The primary focus will be on commercial litigation (contract disputes, fraud, UCC, statutory violations, and business torts), intellectual property litigation, product liability, professional liability, life sciences, employment law, and technology and cybersecurity matters. The attorney holding this position is responsible for managing case files, legal research, preparing legal documents, investigating facts, and attending hearings, depositions, and trials.
Qualified candidates must have 2-4 years of relevant legal experience, strong academic credentials, excellent writing and research skills, and proven ability to analyze sophisticated and complex factual and legal issues. They need to be a self-starter with the ability to work independently on smaller matters, but also within a team structure on larger ones. Courtroom, motion, and deposition experience required, and trial experience preferred. Experience in state and federal courts and with alternative dispute resolution is also desirable.

Note: fully remote position, excellent supplement to your current practice!
Our Nationwide consumer law firm is in search of a licensed attorney to join our growing practice! The ideal candidate will have experience with debt collection related litigation. Experience with the FDCPA, FCRA and Bankruptcy practice are a plus. The candidate should be able to handle debt related cases from inception to conclusion, including but not limited to attending hearings, drafting responsive pleadings, motion practice, and discovery. Those looking to supplement their current practice with additional work are strongly encouraged to apply.
The position is remote; as such, a strong understanding of technology is crucial. This position entails a flexible schedule, as such effective time-management will be a necessary skill. You should have excellent people skills, the ability to work autonomously, and possess excellent organizational and time management skills so as to meet strict deadlines.

Pre-Litigation Attorney: We are seeking an attorney with 1-3 years personal injury experience to join our growing firm in TX. A qualified associate must possess the ability to provide legal representation to advocate for our clients while providing outstanding client service skills.
Qualifications: The candidate must be licensed to practice in the state of Texas, have graduated from an accredited law school and must be a member in good standing of the State Bar of Texas.
The ideal candidate must be able to communicate effectively and possess excellent written, verbal and analytical skills. Candidate must be self-motivated with strong negotiating skills and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced work environment. Although the candidate will receive support and assistance, he/she must have the ability and experience to independently manage and move pending cases forward. Candidate must provide immediate analysis on liability, collectible damages, and communicating the steps team will follow in order to achieve the best results for the client.

Plaintiff Personal Injury Attorney Positions – Litigation / Trial
HEIDARI LAW GROUP, P.C., is one of the fastest growing and successful Plaintiff's Personal Injury law firms in California and Nevada, with principal offices in Los Angeles and Las Vegas, but additional offices throughout both states. We have a growing reputation and the respect of adversaries in our ethical but firm representation of our clients’ interests.
We currently have two litigation attorney and one trial attorney to add to our growing team of four lawyers in Los Angeles, California. We are looking for enthusiastic candidates eager to take ownership of his/her own cases and who is not afraid of gaining trial experience. Unlike other firms, we pride ourselves on taking our cases from intake and up and through to trial, if necessary, which provides our employees and candidates the perfect opportunities to gain extensive trial, litigation, and negotiation experience. The ideal candidate will be comfortable handling all aspects of litigation from pre-litigation filings and discovery to mediations, arbitrations, and including jury trials, if necessary. Our attorneys are always supported by an excellent staff of paralegals and legal assistants to ensure that a positive work environment keeps all employees working as a team.

Qualifications
We are looking for attorneys who solely want to focus on providing our clients with advice and guidance on the best way to move their cases forward. You’ll be a team player who partners closely with our legal team in order to identify the client’s needs and get a strategy in place to set the clients up for success.

Divorce Lawyer for Women
Are you looking to finally put your law degree to use towards something you’d actually enjoy doing?
A position that allows you to make a difference in the lives of your clients?
A career a law firm that actually takes advantage of technology so that you can work remotely when possible, and around the schedule of your children and family?
If this describes you, we’d love you to consider joining the Bruce Law Firm for our open attorney position. We are a divorce and family law firm that focuses mostly on representing women who are married to controlling, manipulative, or narcissistic husbands.
We strive to focus our firm on these cases because we believe that our female clients in these relationships will actually benefit from their marriage being dissolved. If you want to get a better feel for the philosophy of how we approach helping our clients feel free to download a few of our free books at www.DivorceInformationBooks.com.

Labor & Employment Attorney/Lawyer
Marble is a human kind of law firm that combines remarkable legal care, transparency, and heart. By using predictive analytics to accurately price and predict each legal need, a collaboration platform for a faster and optimal case result, and digital communications, Marble makes the experience of getting quality legal care easy and affordable. Marble set out to make legal care more accessible for everyday people by building technology that empowers attorneys to do their best work, and that puts clients in control of the process from start to finish.
We are a fast-growing early-stage startup founded by a team of serial entrepreneurs and is backed by Silicon Valley VC funds.
Marble is looking for a licensed Attorney/Lawyer to begin taking Labor & Employment cases as co-counsel immediately, fully remote.

Company Overview
Price Benowitz, LLP is a mid-sized law firm headquartered in Washington, DC with offices and attorneys throughout Washington, D.C., Maryland and Virginia. The firm handles many areas of law including criminal defense, personal injury, medical malpractice, immigration, trusts and estates, family, OFAC, business transactional and whistleblower law.
Our firm was built on the understanding that comprehensive representation does not begin and end in the courtroom. We know that just having sound legal counsel does not translate to a comprehensive and satisfactory experience for a client. We want our clients to be satisfied with their choice of firm, not just in their choice of attorney. Our client service and support staff are dedicated to making the experience of retaining an attorney as smooth as possible and ensuring that no client ever has a question or concern that goes unanswered. It doesn’t matter how good an attorney is if they don’t pay close attention to the wants and needs of the client. We want to make sure that each of our clients is as happy with the experience they have with our firm as they are with the ultimate result in his or her case.

Price Benowitz, LLP currently has an opening for a Personal Injury Attorney to join their personal injury/medical malpratice team. The attorney will be representing plaintiffs with injury and malpractice matters in the DC metropolitan area. This attorney will work directly with the head of the litigation department to ensure that our clients are provided the representation they deserve. We are committed to hiring attorneys that are passionate about helping people, have a 'no job too-big or too-small' mentality and understand that a person's experience with the firm does not begin and end in the court room. Price Benowitz invests in the success and growth of the firm by hiring staff that not only understand the law but also understand the real-world impact that people face when they are going through a legal matter. This is a perfect opportunity to join a firm with an established team of passionate individuals that are committed to upholding high standards of representation and customer service.

This position provides career building opportunities because mentoring will come directly from the senior partner of 40 years personal injury trial and appellate practice.
Our law firm will also facilitate the selected candidate establishing their own sources of client referrals and business. Our law firm employs twenty (20) lawyers all of whom provide a culture of collegial learning and client devotion. Our law firm continues to grow and expand its client base.
Please send a letter of introduction, resume and salary requests. Medical, dental & optical insurance, 401K and other fringe benefits accompany competitive salaries. Salary depends on experience.

Job description
Case Assessment Attorney (Remote)
Marble is looking for a case assessment attorney to help us meet the demand of incoming cases to ensure everyone has access to affordable legal care. This is a junior-level position with opportunities for advancement. This is a full-time, fully remote position, with flexible hours.
Your primary job responsibility is to perform the initial case consultation. You will be responsible for determining the scope of engagement and pricing based on Marble’s scale.
Qualifications
We are looking for attorneys who solely want to focus on providing our clients with advice and guidance on the best way to move their cases forward. You’ll be a team player who partners closely with our legal team in order to identify the client’s needs and get a strategy in place to set the clients up for success.

Reputable mid-sized law firm is seeking full time Personal Injury Trial Attorney to join our legal team and meaningfully contribute to our practice. The ideal candidate will be detail oriented. This position calls for someone who is able to multi-task.
Qualifications:
- 3 plus years of experience in New Jersey Personal Injury Civil Litigation
- Experience with cases through the trial phase
- Strong desire to win results on behalf of injured clients
- Highly organized

Labor & Employment Attorney/Lawyer
Marble is a human kind of law firm that combines remarkable legal care, transparency, and heart. By using predictive analytics to accurately price and predict each legal need, a collaboration platform for a faster and optimal case result, and digital communications, Marble makes the experience of getting quality legal care easy and affordable. Marble set out to make legal care more accessible for everyday people by building technology that empowers attorneys to do their best work, and that puts clients in control of the process from start to finish.
We are a fast-growing early-stage startup founded by a team of serial entrepreneurs and is backed by Silicon Valley VC funds.
Marble is looking for a licensed Attorney/Lawyer to begin taking Labor & Employment cases as co-counsel immediately, fully remote.

Needed Immediately - Experienced attorney proficient in the Securities Act of 1933 offer, sale and registration statement requirements, including registration on Forms S-1, S-3, S-4 and S-8. Applicants must have experience with a complete IPO process and Form S-3 takedown transactions, including Registered Direct, CMPO and ATM Offerings, and be able to prepare all needed transaction documents including the ProSupp. Applicants must be knowledgeable and experienced with Rule 424 requirements. Work will also include Regulation A Offerings. Attorneys may work remote. The ability to consistently produce a high-quality work product and a strong work ethic are the key considerations. Qualified candidates will receive above market compensation consistent with or above AmLaw 200 pay rates.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $250,000.00 - $500,000.00 per year

Maaswinkel Law is a small plaintiff’s personal injury and worker compensation law firm located near downtown Orlando, Florida. We are looking for an associate with 3 to 5 years of litigation experience and in good standing with the Florida Bar. Defense experience preferred. Must have tried at least 3 jury trials. The candidate must be a “people person” that understands how to effectively communicate with clients of varying degrees of education and sophistication. The candidate must be personable, compassionate, and empathetic towards people that are injured. If it is not in your nature to promptly return phone calls, text messages, and emails, this position is not for you. The candidate will be expected to manage assigned cases from intake, presuit, litigation, trial, and appeal if necessary. Excellent opportunity for an ambitious person.
Compensation includes base salary, bonuses, paid bar dues, paid membership to FJA and CFTLA, retirement benefits, health insurance, and paid time off.
Job Type: Full-time

Lalezary Law Firm is one of the largest and most successful personal injury law firms in California. Our firm is known for not settling a case until we reach the value that our client deserves and we fight aggressively until we get there. Our track record as a law firm that relentlessly fights for justice relentless on behalf of our clients has earned us the distinguished reputation of one of the premier PI law firms in California.
The attorney will have access to plenty of paralegal and secretarial support, to be able to focus on case strategy and trial preparation. The attorney will be expected to take a case from complaint through trial as either first or second chair. Previous personal injury experience is required.
Benefits:
Medical, Vision, Dental and Pet Insurance

Lynberg & Watkins, APC, a law firm with offices throughout Southern California is seeking a 2 to 5 year litigation associate in their San Diego office to assist with all aspects of case handling on insurance defense matters with an emphasis on habitability, toxic tort, insurance fraud, and general liability. Prior experience in summarizing medical records and third-party records, drafting briefs, responding to discovery, taking and defending depositions, and law and motion work is required. Some travel required. Prior trial preparation experience is beneficial but not required.
The right candidate will be a self-starter with excellent attention to detail, strong writing and analytical skills, and be able to work efficiently and independently. Qualified candidates should submit a cover letter, resume and writing sample. Options for remote work and part-time work will be considered based on experience. The firm offers competitive benefits and retirement packages.

A sophisticated boutique pure-entertainment litigation firm in Santa Monica, specializing in intellectual property law and the film, television and music industries, is seeking a highly motivated junior associate with a minimum 2-3 years of solid hands-on litigation experience. The firm has extremely high profile cases involving famous entertainment matters and clients, presenting interesting copyright and trademark issues.
Candidates must have extensive litigation experience in both Federal and California courts, very strong writing skills and high academic credentials from a top-tier law school. The firm offers competitive salaries, and a bonus program. Journal experience and judicial clerkship are a plus. (No phone inquires please).
Job Type: Full-time
Benefits:

Creditor’s Rights law firm and has an position for an Associate Attorney in the Springfield, IL area who will be based out of their home. As an associate you are expected to appear on time to court 5 days per week in all downstate counties that are required each week. You are expected to review all the cases and prepare the relevant orders for each of those calls, trials and motions. Furthermore you are responsible for negotiating with defendants and attorneys while at court, phone, e-mail, and regular mail to settle contested cases. You will also draft and file motions as well as responses to motions from defendants. You are required to provide your own reliable transportation to get to each court house, which will be across the state (mostly downstate). There will be extensive daily driving.
Primary Responsibilities:
Court Appearances – Associate is required to correctly prepare, appear timely, and properly handle court appearances in any downstate counties. It is your responsibility to ensure you are able to timely and reliably appear on time at the given courthouse. You may need to travel overnight for certain locations, driving a car is required for almost all locations.

Job Type: Part-time

Company Overview
Price Benowitz, LLP is a mid-sized law firm headquartered in Washington, DC with offices and attorneys throughout Washington, D.C., Maryland and Virginia. The firm handles many areas of law including criminal defense, personal injury, medical malpractice, immigration, trusts and estates, family, OFAC, business transactional and whistleblower law.
Our firm was built on the understanding that comprehensive representation does not begin and end in the courtroom. We know that just having sound legal counsel does not translate to a comprehensive and satisfactory experience for a client. We want our clients to be satisfied with their choice of firm, not just in their choice of attorney. Our client service and support staff are dedicated to making the experience of retaining an attorney as smooth as possible and ensuring that no client ever has a question or concern that goes unanswered. It doesn’t matter how good an attorney is if they don’t pay close attention to the wants and needs of the client. We want to make sure that each of our clients is as happy with the experience they have with our firm as they are with the ultimate result in his or her case.

Price Benowitz, LLP currently has an opening for a Personal Injury Attorney to join their personal injury/medical malpratice team. The attorney will be representing plaintiffs with injury and malpractice matters in the DC metropolitan area. This attorney will work directly with the head of the litigation department to ensure that our clients are provided the representation they deserve. We are committed to hiring attorneys that are passionate about helping people, have a 'no job too-big or too-small' mentality and understand that a person's experience with the firm does not begin and end in the court room. Price Benowitz invests in the success and growth of the firm by hiring staff that not only understand the law but also understand the real-world impact that people face when they are going through a legal matter. This is a perfect opportunity to join a firm with an established team of passionate individuals that are committed to upholding high standards of representation and customer service.

Company Overview
Price Benowitz, LLP is a mid-sized law firm headquartered in Washington, DC with offices and attorneys throughout Washington, D.C., Maryland and Virginia. The firm handles many areas of law including criminal defense, personal injury, medical malpractice, immigration, trusts and estates, family, OFAC, business transactional and whistleblower law.
Our firm was built on the understanding that comprehensive representation does not begin and end in the courtroom. We know that just having sound legal counsel does not translate to a comprehensive and satisfactory experience for a client. We want our clients to be satisfied with their choice of firm, not just in their choice of attorney. Our client service and support staff are dedicated to making the experience of retaining an attorney as smooth as possible and ensuring that no client ever has a question or concern that goes unanswered. It doesn’t matter how good an attorney is if they don’t pay close attention to the wants and needs of the client. We want to make sure that each of our clients is as happy with the experience they have with our firm as they are with the ultimate result in his or her case.

Price Benowitz invests in the success and growth of the firm by hiring staff that not only understand the law but also understand the real-world impact that people face when they are going through a legal matter. This is a perfect opportunity to join a firm with an established team of passionate individuals that are committed to upholding high standards of representation and customer service.

It is your responsibility to ensure you are able to timely and reliably appear on time at the given courthouse. You may need to travel overnight for certain locations, driving a car is required for almost all locations.

We are seeking full-time attorneys with experience and an interest in personal injury and civil litigation. This posting is for multiple positions. Each position handles all aspects of the litigation process including, but not limited to, direct contact with clients and counsel, drafting motions, pleadings and discovery, legal research including case law research, and appearing in court. One to three years of legal experience in Hawaii and/or California in the personal injury and litigation practice areas are highly desired.

Pre-Litigation Attorney: We are seeking an attorney with 1-3 years personal injury experience to join our growing firm in TX. A qualified associate must possess the ability to provide legal representation to advocate for our clients while providing outstanding client service skills.
Qualifications: The candidate must be licensed to practice in the state of Texas, have graduated from an accredited law school and must be a member in good standing of the State Bar of Texas.
The ideal candidate must be able to communicate effectively and possess excellent written, verbal and analytical skills. Candidate must be self-motivated with strong negotiating skills and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced work environment. Although the candidate will receive support and assistance, he/she must have the ability and experience to independently manage and move pending cases forward. Candidate must provide immediate analysis on liability, collectible damages, and communicating the steps team will follow in order to achieve the best results for the client.

Who We Are:
Gomez Trial Attorneys is a highly successful, community-focused, fast-growing Trial Law Firm headquartered in Downtown San Diego with multiple offices across Southern California.
Our founder, John Gomez, is a leader in the field and has won San Diego’s Outstanding Trial Lawyer Award 11 times. We have been named Top Lawyers in various areas, including personal injury, product liability, mass torts, car accidents, insurance, and corporate litigation. We received the 2018 #1 Intentional Tort verdict and #1 Premises Liability verdict.
As a high-performing and dynamic team, we pride ourselves on doing the right thing, every time, even when no one is looking. Integrity, teamwork, service , and community are our watchwords. You will be helping us reach those in the community who are looking for someone to defend them – helping them through some of the most challenging financial, medical and personal situations people face. Your work means everything to those who need our help. This is what drives all that we do. Every day you can improve lives in your own, unique way – and it all starts with you.

BE THEIR VOICE:
HEROES WANTED
Over the years, our Memphis personal injury lawyers have RESCUED countless people who have been injured, who have been wronged, and who feel like they have nowhere else to turn. Our clients are the David to the Goliath of the corporations that have wronged them, and they feel like their voice isn’t heard. That’s why our firm’s motto is “Let Us Be Your Voice.”
We are looking for attorneys who want to BE THEIR VOICE. Attorneys who want to be the voice of fairness, of justice, for our clients who have been wronged. Over the last 5 years we have been the fastest growing law firm in the Mid-South, and our Attorneys have grown with that case load. Our Attorneys are the BEST in the Mid-South. They are experienced, knowledgeable, CARING, and WINNING. Are you ready to apply to be part of this dynamic, growing team?

Note: fully remote position, excellent supplement to your current practice!
Our Nationwide consumer law firm is in search of a licensed attorney to join our growing practice! The ideal candidate will have experience with debt collection related litigation. Experience with the FDCPA, FCRA and Bankruptcy practice are a plus. The candidate should be able to handle debt related cases from inception to conclusion, including but not limited to attending hearings, drafting responsive pleadings, motion practice, and discovery. Those looking to supplement their current practice with additional work are strongly encouraged to apply.
The position is remote; as such, a strong understanding of technology is crucial. This position entails a flexible schedule, as such effective time-management will be a necessary skill. You should have excellent people skills, the ability to work autonomously, and possess excellent organizational and time management skills so as to meet strict deadlines.

About us
Is your passion trying and winning cases? Do you thrive in a fast-paced, high-volume environment? Do you feel passionately about client service and obtaining justice for clients? We are seeking a client-focused individual to join our established and growing team as a Trial Attorney. As a preeminent personal injury law firm in Los Angeles, we provide a high-volume workplace where you will quickly integrate into our stellar team and case work.
We are proud of our commitment to and vision of providing clients with the highest level of service. The ideal candidate will be someone who wants the chance to make a difference for our clients and contribute to our firm as a whole.
What we’re looking for:

Labor & Employment Attorney/Lawyer
Marble is a human kind of law firm that combines remarkable legal care, transparency, and heart. By using predictive analytics to accurately price and predict each legal need, a collaboration platform for a faster and optimal case result, and digital communications, Marble makes the experience of getting quality legal care easy and affordable. Marble set out to make legal care more accessible for everyday people by building technology that empowers attorneys to do their best work, and that puts clients in control of the process from start to finish.
We are a fast-growing early-stage startup founded by a team of serial entrepreneurs and is backed by Silicon Valley VC funds.
Marble is looking for a licensed Attorney/Lawyer to begin taking Labor & Employment cases as co-counsel immediately, fully remote.

Lalezary Law Firm is one of the largest and most successful personal injury law firms in California. Our firm is known for not settling a case until we reach the value that our client deserves and we fight aggressively until we get there. Our track record as a law firm that relentlessly fights for justice relentless on behalf of our clients has earned us the distinguished reputation of one of the premier PI law firms in California.
The attorney will have access to plenty of paralegal and secretarial support, to be able to focus on case strategy and trial preparation. The attorney will be expected to take a case from complaint through trial as either first or second chair. Previous personal injury experience is required.

Medical, Vision, Dental and Pet Insurance

Maaswinkel Law is a small plaintiff’s personal injury and worker compensation law firm located near downtown Orlando, Florida. Segal McCambridge, a national litigation firm, is seeking an Associate Attorney for our Chicago office. The primary focus will be on commercial litigation (contract disputes, fraud, UCC, statutory violations, and business torts), intellectual property litigation, product liability, professional liability, life sciences, employment law, and technology and cybersecurity matters. The attorney holding this position is responsible for managing case files, legal research, preparing legal documents, investigating facts, and attending hearings, depositions, and trials.
Qualified candidates must have 2-4 years of relevant legal experience, strong academic credentials, excellent writing and research skills, and proven ability to analyze sophisticated and complex factual and legal issues. They need to be a self-starter with the ability to work independently on smaller matters, but also within a team structure on larger ones. Courtroom, motion, and deposition experience required, and trial experience preferred. Experience in state and federal courts and with alternative dispute resolution is also desirable.

Requirements:
-Passed RI or MA Bar
-Detail-oriented
-Strong written, verbal and computer skills
-Excellent time management
-Determined to learn and adapt in a high-paced atmosphere
-Work 50 hours per week
Job Description:
-Communicate with clients, witnesses, insurance adjusters, medical providers and your team in order to resolve a case efficiently and yield the highest possible settlement
-Documenting all action and communication into a Case Management System
-Reviewing medical records/bills
-Managing 2 paralegals
-Acting as an empathetic liaison between clients and their medical providers
-Reviewing police reports and property damage photos
-Understanding comprehensive medical treatment
-Recognizing the costs/benefits of settlements v. suits
-Understanding the applicability of laws and statutes to the potential recovery of each case
-Timely resolution of all case matters assigned to you

Creditor’s Rights law firm and has an position for an Associate Attorney in the Springfield, IL area who will be based out of their home. As an associate you are expected to appear on time to court 5 days per week in all downstate counties that are required each week. You are expected to review all the cases and prepare the relevant orders for each of those calls, trials and motions. Furthermore you are responsible for negotiating with defendants and attorneys while at court, phone, e-mail, and regular mail to settle contested cases. You will also draft and file motions as well as responses to motions from defendants. You are required to provide your own reliable transportation to get to each court house, which will be across the state (mostly downstate). There will be extensive daily driving.
Primary Responsibilities:
Court Appearances – Associate is required to correctly prepare, appear timely, and properly handle court appearances in any downstate counties. It is your responsibility to ensure you are able to timely and reliably appear on time at the given courthouse. You may need to travel overnight for certain locations, driving a car is required for almost all locations.

Our consumer law firm is in search of an experienced attorney licensed in Hawaii to join our team. This is a contract position, so the ideal candidate should either have their own practice already, or be looking to supplement their current income with additional work.
This is a work from home position that requires you to communicate with clients, managing attorneys, and legal support staff remotely -- so a strong understanding of technology is crucial. The ideal candidate should be able to work autonomously with limited supervision, be comfortable managing a high-volume caseload, and have the ability to work a case from inception through to trial/settlement. Excellent organizational & time-management skills are necessary in order to meet strict court deadlines.
Compensation is competitive and commensurate with experience. Please submit a formatted resume for consideration.

Super Lawyers is looking for an experienced Litigation Associate to join our team in Chicago, Illinois. Litigation Associates at Super Lawyers should have exceptional written and oral communication skills, critical thinking skills, attention to detail and excellent organizational skills. The Litigation Associate will work closely with paralegals, accountants, financial advisors and marketing specialists to create actionable solutions that will help our clients move forward.
Responsibilities:
Draft legal documents, such as pleadings and motions.
Conduct legal research.

Your work means everything to those who need our help. This is what drives all that we do. Every day you can improve lives in your own, unique way – and it all starts with you.

Job Title: Associate Attorney - Personal Injury Law Firm
Job Description:
Established personal injury law firm in Dallas, is expanding and has an immediate opening for a licensed Texas attorney. Looking for a highly motivated candidate who is looking for hands-on experience in all matters related to pre-litigation and litigation. Litigation experience is not required, in fact we are looking for newly licensed attorneys to train to do things the right way. You MUST be licensed to practice law in the State of Texas

We are a rapidly growing law firm with a sole focus of Personal Injury Law. Our founding attorney is Board Certified in Personal Injury Trial Law by the Texas Board of Legal Specialization and our senior associate attorney is also board certified.
Company Name: Law Firm of Aaron A. Herbert

Job Description:
This position is primarily responsible for the management of all aspects of personal injury cases from inception through close of case.
Job Responsibilities:
Medical case review.
Negotiating and settling cases in the pre-litigation stage.
Review policies, claims and other records.
Prepare, write and argue legal documents, including but not limited to: memos, theory of liability and demands.
Communicate with insurance companies and make sure client medical treatment is managed and billed accordingly.

Note: fully remote position, excellent supplement to your current practice!
Our Nationwide consumer law firm is in search of a licensed attorney to join our growing practice! The ideal candidate will have experience with debt collection related litigation. Experience with the FDCPA, FCRA and Bankruptcy practice are a plus. The candidate should be able to handle debt related cases from inception to conclusion, including but not limited to attending hearings, drafting responsive pleadings, motion practice, and discovery. Those looking to supplement their current practice with additional work are strongly encouraged to apply.
The position is remote; as such, a strong understanding of technology is crucial. This position entails a flexible schedule, as such effective time-management will be a necessary skill. You should have excellent people skills, the ability to work autonomously, and possess excellent organizational and time management skills so as to meet strict deadlines.

Pre-Litigation Attorney: We are seeking an attorney with 1-3 years personal injury experience to join our growing firm in TX. A qualified associate must possess the ability to provide legal representation to advocate for our clients while providing outstanding client service skills.
Qualifications: The candidate must be licensed to practice in the state of Texas, have graduated from an accredited law school and must be a member in good standing of the State Bar of Texas.
The ideal candidate must be able to communicate effectively and possess excellent written, verbal and analytical skills. Candidate must be self-motivated with strong negotiating skills and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced work environment. Although the candidate will receive support and assistance, he/she must have the ability and experience to independently manage and move pending cases forward. Candidate must provide immediate analysis on liability, collectible damages, and communicating the steps team will follow in order to achieve the best results for the client.

Plaintiff Personal Injury Attorney Positions – Litigation / Trial

We have a growing reputation and the respect of adversaries in our ethical but firm representation of our clients’ interests.
We currently have two litigation attorney and one trial attorney to add to our growing team of four lawyers in Los Angeles, California. We are looking for enthusiastic candidates eager to take ownership of his/her own cases and who is not afraid of gaining trial experience. Unlike other firms, we pride ourselves on taking our cases from intake and up and through to trial, if necessary, which provides our employees and candidates the perfect opportunities to gain extensive trial, litigation, and negotiation experience. Job Description:
Segal McCambridge, a national litigation firm, is seeking an Associate Attorney for our Chicago office. The primary focus will be on commercial litigation (contract disputes, fraud, UCC, statutory violations, and business torts), intellectual property litigation, product liability, professional liability, life sciences, employment law, and technology and cybersecurity matters. The attorney holding this position is responsible for managing case files, legal research, preparing legal documents, investigating facts, and attending hearings, depositions, and trials.
Qualified candidates must have 2-4 years of relevant legal experience, strong academic credentials, excellent writing and research skills, and proven ability to analyze sophisticated and complex factual and legal issues. They need to be a self-starter with the ability to work independently on smaller matters, but also within a team structure on larger ones. Courtroom, motion, and deposition experience required, and trial experience preferred. Experience in state and federal courts and with alternative dispute resolution is also desirable.

Creditor’s Rights law firm and has an position for an Associate Attorney in the Springfield, IL area who will be based out of their home. As an associate you are expected to appear on time to court 5 days per week in all downstate counties that are required each week. You are expected to review all the cases and prepare the relevant orders for each of those calls, trials and motions. Furthermore you are responsible for negotiating with defendants and attorneys while at court, phone, e-mail, and regular mail to settle contested cases. You will also draft and file motions as well as responses to motions from defendants. You are required to provide your own reliable transportation to get to each court house, which will be across the state (mostly downstate). There will be extensive daily driving.
Primary Responsibilities:
Court Appearances – Associate is required to correctly prepare, appear timely, and properly handle court appearances in any downstate counties. It is your responsibility to ensure you are able to timely and reliably appear on time at the given courthouse. You may need to travel overnight for certain locations, driving a car is required for almost all locations.

Excellent organizational & time-management skills are necessary in order to meet strict court deadlines.
Compensation is competitive and commensurate with experience. Please submit a formatted resume for consideration.

About us

What we’re looking for:

Messner Reeves LLP, an established full-service, business law firm, with 12 offices nationwide, seeks an experienced Litigation Attorney in our Salt Lake City office.
This is not your typical law firm. What you will not find at Messner Reeves is bureaucracy, politics, committees, or unnecessary meetings in stuffy boardrooms; instead, you would be joining a collaborative, energetic group of intellectual capital dressed comfortably and working hard for their clients. You will see collaborations taking place and entrepreneurial minds thinking outside the box to create common-sense solutions to complex problems.
Who better to manage the direction and growth of your career than you? At Messner Reeves, you are in the driver seat with complete control of your future. With exceptional resources and full support from the firm, you are empowered to immediately begin building your client base and grow your practice. When we were founded, over 25 years ago we were entrepreneurial out of necessity, but now we maintain our entrepreneurial spirit by choice.

Kubicki Draper is a full-service law firm founded in 1963 providing trial, appellate, coverage, commercial and real estate transaction services. With over 180 attorneys and 12 offices, we represent clients throughout the entire State of Florida and the southern parts of Georgia, Alabama and Mississippi.
