Job Title: Plaintiff Personal Injury Attorney Positions – Litigation / Trial LA
Job Description:
Plaintiff Personal Injury Attorney Positions – Litigation / Trial
HEIDARI LAW GROUP, P.C., is one of the fastest growing and successful Plaintiff's Personal Injury law firms in California and Nevada, with principal offices in Los Angeles and Las Vegas, but additional offices throughout both states. We have a growing reputation and the respect of adversaries in our ethical but firm representation of our clients’ interests.
We currently have two litigation attorney and one trial attorney to add to our growing team of four lawyers in Los Angeles, California. We are looking for enthusiastic candidates eager to take ownership of his/her own cases and who is not afraid of gaining trial experience. Unlike other firms, we pride ourselves on taking our cases from intake and up and through to trial, if necessary, which provides our employees and candidates the perfect opportunities to gain extensive trial, litigation, and negotiation experience. The ideal candidate will be comfortable handling all aspects of litigation from pre-litigation filings and discovery to mediations, arbitrations, and including jury trials, if necessary. Our attorneys are always supported by an excellent staff of paralegals and legal assistants to ensure that a positive work environment keeps all employees working as a team.

Established and fast growing plaintiff’s personal injury firm is looking for a dynamic litigator. Downtown LA Law Group represents seriously injured individuals including catastrophic injuries and wrongful death. We pride ourselves in having an excellent work culture and pursuing a relentless passion to ensure justice for clients.
The attorney candidate is expected to hit the ground running from day 1. You will be responsible for cases from filing to trial, including settlement negotiations, taking and defending depositions, court appearances, motion practice and trial. You will be tasked with developing case strategies and theories. You will have access to paralegal and secretarial support, as well as law and motion assistance so that you can focus on strategy and litigation.
Qualifications:
Juris Doctorate degree and current good standing with CA State bar is required

- Experience with cases through the trial phase
- Strong desire to win results on behalf of injured clients

Segal McCambridge, a national litigation firm, is seeking an Associate Attorney for our Chicago office. The primary focus will be on commercial litigation (contract disputes, fraud, UCC, statutory violations, and business torts), intellectual property litigation, product liability, professional liability, life sciences, employment law, and technology and cybersecurity matters. The attorney holding this position is responsible for managing case files, legal research, preparing legal documents, investigating facts, and attending hearings, depositions, and trials.
Qualified candidates must have 2-4 years of relevant legal experience, strong academic credentials, excellent writing and research skills, and proven ability to analyze sophisticated and complex factual and legal issues. They need to be a self-starter with the ability to work independently on smaller matters, but also within a team structure on larger ones. Courtroom, motion, and deposition experience required, and trial experience preferred. Experience in state and federal courts and with alternative dispute resolution is also desirable.

Job Description:
Creditor’s Rights law firm and has an position for an Associate Attorney in the Springfield, IL area who will be based out of their home. As an associate you are expected to appear on time to court 5 days per week in all downstate counties that are required each week. You are expected to review all the cases and prepare the relevant orders for each of those calls, trials and motions. Furthermore you are responsible for negotiating with defendants and attorneys while at court, phone, e-mail, and regular mail to settle contested cases. You will also draft and file motions as well as responses to motions from defendants. You are required to provide your own reliable transportation to get to each court house, which will be across the state (mostly downstate). There will be extensive daily driving.
Primary Responsibilities:
Court Appearances – Associate is required to correctly prepare, appear timely, and properly handle court appearances in any downstate counties. It is your responsibility to ensure you are able to timely and reliably appear on time at the given courthouse. You may need to travel overnight for certain locations, driving a car is required for almost all locations.

We prioritize continuous improvement.

HEROES WANTED

Unlike other firms, we pride ourselves on taking our cases from intake and up and through to trial, if necessary, which provides our employees and candidates the perfect opportunities to gain extensive trial, litigation, and negotiation experience. The attorney holding this position is responsible for managing case files, legal research, preparing legal documents, investigating facts, and attending hearings, depositions, and trials.
Qualified candidates must have 2-4 years of relevant legal experience, strong academic credentials, excellent writing and research skills, and proven ability to analyze sophisticated and complex factual and legal issues. They need to be a self-starter with the ability to work independently on smaller matters, but also within a team structure on larger ones. Courtroom, motion, and deposition experience required, and trial experience preferred. Experience in state and federal courts and with alternative dispute resolution is also desirable.

It is your responsibility to ensure you are able to timely and reliably appear on time at the given courthouse. You may need to travel overnight for certain locations, driving a car is required for almost all locations.

You MUST be licensed to practice law in the State of Texas

We are a rapidly growing law firm with a sole focus of Personal Injury Law. Our founding attorney is Board Certified in Personal Injury Trial Law by the Texas Board of Legal Specialization and our senior associate attorney is also board certified.
Company Name: Law Firm of Aaron A. Herbert

Job Description:
Must be licensed attorney in good standing with ISB, indigent legal defense for juvenile & child protection, felonies and misdemeanors. Attorneys provided from arraignment through disposition of case. Must provide competent & zealous representation to clients as required by the Idaho Rules of Professional Conduct & the Idaho Public Defense Act. Interested attorneys may have a broad range of experience in misdemeanor/felony criminal litigation, juvenile cases, child protection matters, criminal &/or civil contempts. We do a lot of courtroom work and litigation of jury trials. Quarterly bonuses based on production.

BE THEIR VOICE:
HEROES WANTED
Over the years, our Memphis personal injury lawyers have RESCUED countless people who have been injured, who have been wronged, and who feel like they have nowhere else to turn. Our clients are the David to the Goliath of the corporations that have wronged them, and they feel like their voice isn’t heard. That’s why our firm’s motto is “Let Us Be Your Voice.”

Lalezary Law Firm is one of the largest and most successful personal injury law firms in California. Our firm is known for not settling a case until we reach the value that our client deserves and we fight aggressively until we get there. Our track record as a law firm that relentlessly fights for justice relentless on behalf of our clients has earned us the distinguished reputation of one of the premier PI law firms in California.
The attorney will have access to plenty of paralegal and secretarial support, to be able to focus on case strategy and trial preparation. The attorney will be expected to take a case from complaint through trial as either first or second chair. Previous personal injury experience is required.

Medical, Vision, Dental and Pet Insurance

This is a position for an associate attorney in a small law firm in Western Wisconsin in the Minneapolis-Saint Paul metro area.
There are multiple positions available for candidates interested in developing their practice, including the opportunity to specialize in any given area of practice.

Burnham Brown, a mid-size business counseling and litigation firm is looking for a California licensed litigation attorney with 3-5 years of experience. This full-time (at-will) position is based at Burnham Brown’s headquarters near beautiful Lake Merritt in Oakland, California, although most work is performed remotely at this time. Competitive salary and benefits. Salary based upon experience.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $100,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year
Benefits:
401(k)
Dental insurance

Established and fast growing plaintiff’s personal injury firm is looking for a dynamic litigator. Downtown LA Law Group represents seriously injured individuals including catastrophic injuries and wrongful death. We pride ourselves in having an excellent work culture and pursuing a relentless passion to ensure justice for clients.
The attorney candidate is expected to hit the ground running from day 1. You will be responsible for cases from filing to trial, including settlement negotiations, taking and defending depositions, court appearances, motion practice and trial. You will be tasked with developing case strategies and theories. You will have access to paralegal and secretarial support, as well as law and motion assistance so that you can focus on strategy and litigation.
Qualifications:
Juris Doctorate degree and current good standing with CA State bar is required

Pre-Litigation Attorney: We are seeking an attorney with 1-3 years personal injury experience to join our growing firm in TX. A qualified associate must possess the ability to provide legal representation to advocate for our clients while providing outstanding client service skills.
Qualifications: The candidate must be licensed to practice in the state of Texas, have graduated from an accredited law school and must be a member in good standing of the State Bar of Texas.
The ideal candidate must be able to communicate effectively and possess excellent written, verbal and analytical skills. Candidate must be self-motivated with strong negotiating skills and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced work environment. Although the candidate will receive support and assistance, he/she must have the ability and experience to independently manage and move pending cases forward. Candidate must provide immediate analysis on liability, collectible damages, and communicating the steps team will follow in order to achieve the best results for the client.

Note: fully remote position, excellent supplement to your current practice!
Our Nationwide consumer law firm is in search of a licensed attorney to join our growing practice! The ideal candidate will have experience with debt collection related litigation. Experience with the FDCPA, FCRA and Bankruptcy practice are a plus. The candidate should be able to handle debt related cases from inception to conclusion, including but not limited to attending hearings, drafting responsive pleadings, motion practice, and discovery. Those looking to supplement their current practice with additional work are strongly encouraged to apply.
The position is remote; as such, a strong understanding of technology is crucial. This position entails a flexible schedule, as such effective time-management will be a necessary skill. You should have excellent people skills, the ability to work autonomously, and possess excellent organizational and time management skills so as to meet strict deadlines.

Labor & Employment Attorney/Lawyer
Marble is a human kind of law firm that combines remarkable legal care, transparency, and heart. Job Title: Plaintiff Personal Injury Attorney Positions – Litigation / Trial LA
Job Description:
Plaintiff Personal Injury Attorney Positions – Litigation / Trial
HEIDARI LAW GROUP, P.C., is one of the fastest growing and successful Plaintiff's Personal Injury law firms in California and Nevada, with principal offices in Los Angeles and Las Vegas, but additional offices throughout both states. We have a growing reputation and the respect of adversaries in our ethical but firm representation of our clients’ interests.
We currently have two litigation attorney and one trial attorney to add to our growing team of four lawyers in Los Angeles, California. We are looking for enthusiastic candidates eager to take ownership of his/her own cases and who is not afraid of gaining trial experience. Unlike other firms, we pride ourselves on taking our cases from intake and up and through to trial, if necessary, which provides our employees and candidates the perfect opportunities to gain extensive trial, litigation, and negotiation experience. The ideal candidate will be comfortable handling all aspects of litigation from pre-litigation filings and discovery to mediations, arbitrations, and including jury trials, if necessary. Our attorneys are always supported by an excellent staff of paralegals and legal assistants to ensure that a positive work environment keeps all employees working as a team.

Maaswinkel Law is a small plaintiff’s personal injury and worker compensation law firm located near downtown Orlando, Florida. We are looking for an associate with 3 to 5 years of litigation experience and in good standing with the Florida Bar. Defense experience preferred. Must have tried at least 3 jury trials. The candidate must be a “people person” that understands how to effectively communicate with clients of varying degrees of education and sophistication. The candidate must be personable, compassionate, and empathetic towards people that are injured. If it is not in your nature to promptly return phone calls, text messages, and emails, this position is not for you. The candidate will be expected to manage assigned cases from intake, presuit, litigation, trial, and appeal if necessary. Excellent opportunity for an ambitious person.
Compensation includes base salary, bonuses, paid bar dues, paid membership to FJA and CFTLA, retirement benefits, health insurance, and paid time off.
Job Type: Full-time

Segal McCambridge, a national litigation firm, is seeking an Associate Attorney for our Chicago office. The primary focus will be on commercial litigation (contract disputes, fraud, UCC, statutory violations, and business torts), intellectual property litigation, product liability, professional liability, life sciences, employment law, and technology and cybersecurity matters. The attorney holding this position is responsible for managing case files, legal research, preparing legal documents, investigating facts, and attending hearings, depositions, and trials.
Qualified candidates must have 2-4 years of relevant legal experience, strong academic credentials, excellent writing and research skills, and proven ability to analyze sophisticated and complex factual and legal issues. They need to be a self-starter with the ability to work independently on smaller matters, but also within a team structure on larger ones. Courtroom, motion, and deposition experience required, and trial experience preferred. Experience in state and federal courts and with alternative dispute resolution is also desirable.

Burford & Ryburn, L.L.P. is seeking an energetic and dedicated associate attorney with 1 – 3 years of experience in civil defense litigation to join our law firm team. You’ll work on a variety of cases and ensure the needs of our clients are always placed as our top priority.
Associate Attorney Responsibilities
Draft motions and prepare reports
Manage designated litigation caseload
Review client documents and claim files in preparation for deadlines
Participate in court appearances and depositions
Communicate with clients and provide status reports

Established Tucson law firm is seeking a Personal Injury Litigation Associate. We are seeking an attorney with 1 - 5 years of related experience.
Requirements:
Personal Injury Law: 1 - 5 years (Preferred).
License to practice law in Arizona and current good standing with AZ State Bar is required.
Strong academic credentials and excellent oral and written communication skills are required.
Must have experience in personal injury law and personal injury litigation.
Attorney will handle personal injury litigation cases.

Looking for a Lawyer for a Personal Injury Law Firm

This is a great opportunity to get experience in the Personal Injury Plaintiff's field with a competitive salary. The job would include writing demand letters, a lot of client communication, writing motions and pleadings, attending hearings etc. $85,000.00/year with the potential to earn $250,000.00+
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $85,000.00 - $250,000.00 per year

- 3 plus years of experience in New Jersey Personal Injury Civil Litigation
- Experience with cases through the trial phase
- Strong desire to win results on behalf of injured clients
- Highly organized

Busy injury law firm in Des Plaines is looking for an associate attorney with 2-3 years of litigation experience. This role is a great opportunity for anyone who wants to be a litigator. Cases are primarily Cook County, but the firm does handle some matters in the collar counties and Federal Court.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $65,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year

401(k)
401(k) matching

Our consumer law firm is in search of an experienced attorney licensed in Hawaii to join our team. This is a contract position, so the ideal candidate should either have their own practice already, or be looking to supplement their current income with additional work.
This is a work from home position that requires you to communicate with clients, managing attorneys, and legal support staff remotely -- so a strong understanding of technology is crucial. The ideal candidate should be able to work autonomously with limited supervision, be comfortable managing a high-volume caseload, and have the ability to work a case from inception through to trial/settlement. Excellent organizational & time-management skills are necessary in order to meet strict court deadlines.
Compensation is competitive and commensurate with experience. Please submit a formatted resume for consideration.

Requirements:
-Passed RI or MA Bar
-Detail-oriented
-Strong written, verbal and computer skills
-Excellent time management
-Determined to learn and adapt in a high-paced atmosphere
-Work 50 hours per week
Job Description:
-Communicate with clients, witnesses, insurance adjusters, medical providers and your team in order to resolve a case efficiently and yield the highest possible settlement
-Documenting all action and communication into a Case Management System
-Reviewing medical records/bills
-Managing 2 paralegals
-Acting as an empathetic liaison between clients and their medical providers
-Reviewing police reports and property damage photos
-Understanding comprehensive medical treatment
-Recognizing the costs/benefits of settlements v. suits
-Understanding the applicability of laws and statutes to the potential recovery of each case
-Timely resolution of all case matters assigned to you

Based in Beverly Hills, we are a leading personal injury law firm seeking experienced, quality team members. At BD&J, our employees are our biggest assets. We pride ourselves on treating everyone like family with experience our clients can trust. It’s also a reflection of our attorneys’ compassion, track record and relentless need to fight for justice. It’s this commitment to success that has distinguished us as the premier personal injury law firm in the Los Angeles area and in California.
At BD&J we have five organizational certainties:
We prioritize continuous improvement.
We passionately honor the industry that we represent.
We always maintain a consciousness for uniqueness and authenticity.

Job Title: Junior Attorney to Join Collegial, Entrepreneurial, Socially-Conscious Firm
Job Description:
Please include a brief cover letter to let us know why you are interested. Applications without cover letters will not be considered. You can include the cover letter with your resume or send it directly to Mark Lyda (email on website).
Remember why you went to law school? We do too! We have been building a firm to help you preserve those ideals. Our mission is to increase access to high-quality legal services for small businesses and moderate-income individuals.
This job is for an attorney (can be a new attorney) to join our main office in Denver. We are still working remotely. You will be working under the supervision of our positive and collegial team.
Our firm is not for everyone; but for some, we are a unique fit. We compensate purely through revenue sharing, and our firm culture is different from a typical law firm. We are looking for someone entrepreneurial - we will help you develop business, but we expect our attorneys to take a proactive role in building their clientele.

Litigation Associate Position:
Do you want to spend your time doing menial tasks while working from home or prepare and help try high exposure cases on behalf of Fortune 500 clients?
Do you want to stay home or travel all across the United States to depositions, trials and meeting witnesses and clients?
Do you look to the future and see the opportunities it presents to work with bright, aggressive, well-educated and experienced attorneys?
If you are ready to grow and work with a top boutique defense firm, with great clients, an excellent work environment and excellent compensation and benefits package, contact Yukevich | Cavanaugh today.

Our consumer law firm is in search of an experienced litigation attorney to join our team. This is a work from home position that requires you to communicate with clients, managing attorneys, and legal support staff remotely -- so a strong understanding of technology is crucial. The ideal candidate should be able to work autonomously with limited supervision, be comfortable managing a high-volume caseload, and have the ability to work a case from inception through to trial/settlement. Excellent organizational & time-management skills are necessary in order to meet strict court deadlines. A J.D. from an accredited law school is required, as well as being active and in good standing in the state of Illinois.
Compensation is competitive and commensurate with experience. Medical insurance reimbursement is also provided for most candidates. Please submit a formatted resume for consideration.

Each position handles all aspects of the litigation process including, but not limited to, direct contact with clients and counsel, drafting motions, pleadings and discovery, legal research including case law research, and appearing in court. One to three years of legal experience in Hawaii and/or California in the personal injury and litigation practice areas are highly desired.

Our Trial Lawyers handle cases from intake through settlement or jury verdict.

Personal Injury Law: 1 - 5 years (Preferred).

Job Title: Personal Injury Lawyer at Blakeley Law Firm

Looking for a Lawyer for a Personal Injury Law Firm
Looking for a Lawyer for a Personal Injury Law Firm in Fort Lauderdale. Must have passed the Bar and be eligible to practice in Florida right now. No experience required for the right candidate. We are willing to hire someone just out of law school for this position. Prior experience at a State Attorney's or Public Defender's Office or a similar type of job would be considered favorably. This is a great opportunity to get experience in the Personal Injury Plaintiff's field with a competitive salary. - 3 plus years of experience in New Jersey Personal Injury Civil Litigation
- Experience with cases through the trial phase
- Strong desire to win results on behalf of injured clients

Busy injury law firm in Des Plaines is looking for an associate attorney with 2-3 years of litigation experience. The ideal candidate is someone who is prepared to handle their own case load, and ready to take depositions and try cases. Our attorneys are supported by an excellent staff. This role is a great opportunity for anyone who wants to be a litigator. Cases are primarily Cook County, but the firm does handle some matters in the collar counties and Federal Court.
Job Type: Full-time

401(k)
401(k) matching

Our consumer law firm is in search of an experienced attorney licensed in Hawaii to join our team. This is a contract position, so the ideal candidate should either have their own practice already, or be looking to supplement their current income with additional work.
This is a work from home position that requires you to communicate with clients, managing attorneys, and legal support staff remotely -- so a strong understanding of technology is crucial. The ideal candidate should be able to work autonomously with limited supervision, be comfortable managing a high-volume caseload, and have the ability to work a case from inception through to trial/settlement. Excellent organizational & time-management skills are necessary in order to meet strict court deadlines.
Compensation is competitive and commensurate with experience. Please submit a formatted resume for consideration.

Requirements:
-Passed RI or MA Bar
-Detail-oriented
-Strong written, verbal and computer skills
-Excellent time management
-Determined to learn and adapt in a high-paced atmosphere
-Work 50 hours per week
Job Description:
-Communicate with clients, witnesses, insurance adjusters, medical providers and your team in order to resolve a case efficiently and yield the highest possible settlement
-Documenting all action and communication into a Case Management System
-Reviewing medical records/bills
-Managing 2 paralegals
-Acting as an empathetic liaison between clients and their medical providers
-Reviewing police reports and property damage photos
-Understanding comprehensive medical treatment
-Recognizing the costs/benefits of settlements v. suits
-Understanding the applicability of laws and statutes to the potential recovery of each case
-Timely resolution of all case matters assigned to you

Based in Beverly Hills, we are a leading personal injury law firm seeking experienced, quality team members. At BD&J, our employees are our biggest assets. We pride ourselves on treating everyone like family with experience our clients can trust. It’s also a reflection of our attorneys’ compassion, track record and relentless need to fight for justice. It’s this commitment to success that has distinguished us as the premier personal injury law firm in the Los Angeles area and in California.
At BD&J we have five organizational certainties:
We prioritize continuous improvement.
We passionately honor the industry that we represent.
We always maintain a consciousness for uniqueness and authenticity.

Job Title: Junior Attorney to Join Collegial, Entrepreneurial, Socially-Conscious Firm
Job Description:
Please include a brief cover letter to let us know why you are interested. Applications without cover letters will not be considered. You can include the cover letter with your resume or send it directly to Mark Lyda (email on website).
Remember why you went to law school? We do too! We have been building a firm to help you preserve those ideals. Our mission is to increase access to high-quality legal services for small businesses and moderate-income individuals.
This job is for an attorney (can be a new attorney) to join our main office in Denver. We are still working remotely. You will be working under the supervision of our positive and collegial team.
Our firm is not for everyone; but for some, we are a unique fit. We compensate purely through revenue sharing, and our firm culture is different from a typical law firm. We are looking for someone entrepreneurial - we will help you develop business, but we expect our attorneys to take a proactive role in building their clientele.

Litigation Associate Position:
Do you want to spend your time doing menial tasks while working from home or prepare and help try high exposure cases on behalf of Fortune 500 clients?
Do you want to stay home or travel all across the United States to depositions, trials and meeting witnesses and clients?
Do you look to the future and see the opportunities it presents to work with bright, aggressive, well-educated and experienced attorneys?
If you are ready to grow and work with a top boutique defense firm, with great clients, an excellent work environment and excellent compensation and benefits package, contact Yukevich | Cavanaugh today.

Our consumer law firm is in search of an experienced litigation attorney to join our team. This is a work from home position that requires you to communicate with clients, managing attorneys, and legal support staff remotely -- so a strong understanding of technology is crucial. The ideal candidate should be able to work autonomously with limited supervision, be comfortable managing a high-volume caseload, and have the ability to work a case from inception through to trial/settlement. Excellent organizational & time-management skills are necessary in order to meet strict court deadlines. A J.D. from an accredited law school is required, as well as being active and in good standing in the state of Illinois.
Compensation is competitive and commensurate with experience. Medical insurance reimbursement is also provided for most candidates. Please submit a formatted resume for consideration.
Job Type: Full-time

Boutique Plaintiffs’ personal injury, medical malpractice, and commercial litigation firm seeking associate attorney with 0-5 years experience, or recent graduates with clerking experience with either a law firm or a judge. Attorney – Personal Injury / Litigation
Job Description
Hew & Bordenave, LLP is a Honolulu-based law firm that handles personal injury, litigation, and transactional / compliance matters throughout Hawaii and California.
We are seeking full-time attorneys with experience and an interest in personal injury and civil litigation. This posting is for multiple positions. Each position handles all aspects of the litigation process including, but not limited to, direct contact with clients and counsel, drafting motions, pleadings and discovery, legal research including case law research, and appearing in court. One to three years of legal experience in Hawaii and/or California in the personal injury and litigation practice areas are highly desired.

Alexander Shunnarah Trial Attorneys is a rapidly growing personal injury law firm based in Alabama with offices and cases across the nation. We handle complex cases and provide each attorney with the support staff they need enabling us to best serve our clients. Our attorneys pride themselves on their skill set, experience, compassion, and commitment to helping our clients daily. At Alexander Shunnarah Trial Attorneys, we take a real approach. We are innovative, always finding ways to be better, and have a go-getter mentality across the board. Our firm is a member of several outside leadership organizations and listed as Best Attorney in About Town Magazine and B Metro for 2019 -2020. Our firm is proud of our several attorneys who have been names Super Lawyers and Rising Stars.
We are looking for an ambitious and passionate Trial Lawyer to join our growing team in Arkansas. As a Trial Lawyer, you will work alongside a dynamic and experienced team of Attorneys across the nation, and have local and remote support staff. A typical day for an Attorney at Alexander Shunnarah Trial Attorneys involves client communication, taking and defending depositions, research and drafting, leading mediations, developing case strategies, taking cases to trial. Our Trial Lawyers handle cases from intake through settlement or jury verdict.
Company Name: Alexander Shunnarah Personal Injury Lawyers P.C

Job Title: Associate Attorney - Personal Injury Law Firm
Job Description:
Established personal injury law firm in Dallas, is expanding and has an immediate opening for a licensed Texas attorney. Looking for a highly motivated candidate who is looking for hands-on experience in all matters related to pre-litigation and litigation. Litigation experience is not required, in fact we are looking for newly licensed attorneys to train to do things the right way. Either way there would be extensive experience and training gained from working with two highly experienced personal injury attorneys. Bilingual in English and Spanish is a plus. Requirements to submit a resume:
You MUST be licensed to practice law in the State of Texas
Only submit your resume in .pdf format.
We are a rapidly growing law firm with a sole focus of Personal Injury Law. Our founding attorney is Board Certified in Personal Injury Trial Law by the Texas Board of Legal Specialization and our senior associate attorney is also board certified.
Company Name: Law Firm of Aaron A. Herbert

Job Description:
Must be licensed attorney in good standing with ISB, indigent legal defense for juvenile & child protection, felonies and misdemeanors. Attorneys provided from arraignment through disposition of case. Must provide competent & zealous representation to clients as required by the Idaho Rules of Professional Conduct & the Idaho Public Defense Act. Interested attorneys may have a broad range of experience in misdemeanor/felony criminal litigation, juvenile cases, child protection matters, criminal &/or civil contempts. We do a lot of courtroom work and litigation of jury trials. Quarterly bonuses based on production.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $30.00 - $45.00 per hour
Benefits:

BE THEIR VOICE:
HEROES WANTED
Over the years, our Memphis personal injury lawyers have RESCUED countless people who have been injured, who have been wronged, and who feel like they have nowhere else to turn. Our clients are the David to the Goliath of the corporations that have wronged them, and they feel like their voice isn’t heard. That’s why our firm’s motto is “Let Us Be Your Voice.”
We are looking for attorneys who want to BE THEIR VOICE. Attorneys who want to be the voice of fairness, of justice, for our clients who have been wronged. Over the last 5 years we have been the fastest growing law firm in the Mid-South, and our Attorneys have grown with that case load. Our Attorneys are the BEST in the Mid-South. They are experienced, knowledgeable, CARING, and WINNING. Are you ready to apply to be part of this dynamic, growing team?

Lalezary Law Firm is one of the largest and most successful personal injury law firms in California. Our firm is known for not settling a case until we reach the value that our client deserves and we fight aggressively until we get there. Our track record as a law firm that relentlessly fights for justice relentless on behalf of our clients has earned us the distinguished reputation of one of the premier PI law firms in California.
The attorney will have access to plenty of paralegal and secretarial support, to be able to focus on case strategy and trial preparation. The attorney will be expected to take a case from complaint through trial as either first or second chair. Previous personal injury experience is required.
Benefits:
Medical, Vision, Dental and Pet Insurance

This is a position for an associate attorney in a small law firm in Western Wisconsin in the Minneapolis-Saint Paul metro area.
There are multiple positions available for candidates interested in developing their practice, including the opportunity to specialize in any given area of practice.
The firm practices in a wide range of areas and, with the need for legal services in this rapidly-growing part of the state, it offers excellent opportunities to develop your skill and practice in a collegial and professional environment.
Any candidate must be eligible to be admitted to practice law in Wisconsin. The practice is based in Wisconsin. There may also be opportunity to practice in Minnesota, but the primary practice is in Wisconsin.
Company Name: Rodli, Beskar, Neuhaus, Murray & Pletcher, S.C.

Job Description:
Burnham Brown, a mid-size business counseling and litigation firm is looking for a California licensed litigation attorney with 3-5 years of experience. Some real estate experience is a plus, but not required. This full-time (at-will) position is based at Burnham Brown’s headquarters near beautiful Lake Merritt in Oakland, California, although most work is performed remotely at this time. Competitive salary and benefits. Salary based upon experience.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $100,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year
Benefits:
401(k)
Dental insurance

Established and fast growing plaintiff’s personal injury firm is looking for a dynamic litigator. Downtown LA Law Group represents seriously injured individuals including catastrophic injuries and wrongful death. We pride ourselves in having an excellent work culture and pursuing a relentless passion to ensure justice for clients.
The attorney candidate is expected to hit the ground running from day 1. You will be responsible for cases from filing to trial, including settlement negotiations, taking and defending depositions, court appearances, motion practice and trial. You will be tasked with developing case strategies and theories. You will have access to paralegal and secretarial support, as well as law and motion assistance so that you can focus on strategy and litigation.
Qualifications:
Juris Doctorate degree and current good standing with CA State bar is required

Pre-Litigation Attorney: We are seeking an attorney with 1-3 years personal injury experience to join our growing firm in TX. A qualified associate must possess the ability to provide legal representation to advocate for our clients while providing outstanding client service skills.
Qualifications: The candidate must be licensed to practice in the state of Texas, have graduated from an accredited law school and must be a member in good standing of the State Bar of Texas.
The ideal candidate must be able to communicate effectively and possess excellent written, verbal and analytical skills. Candidate must be self-motivated with strong negotiating skills and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced work environment. Although the candidate will receive support and assistance, he/she must have the ability and experience to independently manage and move pending cases forward. Candidate must provide immediate analysis on liability, collectible damages, and communicating the steps team will follow in order to achieve the best results for the client.

Note: fully remote position, excellent supplement to your current practice!
Our Nationwide consumer law firm is in search of a licensed attorney to join our growing practice! The ideal candidate will have experience with debt collection related litigation. Experience with the FDCPA, FCRA and Bankruptcy practice are a plus. The candidate should be able to handle debt related cases from inception to conclusion, including but not limited to attending hearings, drafting responsive pleadings, motion practice, and discovery. Those looking to supplement their current practice with additional work are strongly encouraged to apply.
The position is remote; as such, a strong understanding of technology is crucial. This position entails a flexible schedule, as such effective time-management will be a necessary skill. You should have excellent people skills, the ability to work autonomously, and possess excellent organizational and time management skills so as to meet strict deadlines.

Established well-regarded White Plains medical malpractice defense firm seeks trial attorney with demonstrated medical malpractice verdict history for promising career opportunity. Firm is also seeking a senior associate with 5 to 7 years medical malpractice defense experience.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $100,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year
Benefits:
401(k)
Health insurance
Paid time off

Job Title: Trial Attorney - Personal Injury Law Firm
Job Description:
Queens personal injury firm seeks a trial attorney with 2-5 years of personal injury trial experience. Firm provides a welcoming and supportive environment as well as growth potential. Compensation package combines salary plus a portion of fees generated by the attorney.
PLEASE ONLY APPLY IF YOU HAVE TRIAL ATTORNEY PERSONAL INJURY LAW FIRM EXPERIENCE.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: Up to $75.00 per hour
Benefits:
401(k) matching

Experienced Criminal Trial Attorney
Hanlon Law, PA - Sarasota / Bradenton
The law office of Hanlon Law, PA is seeking an aggressive associate attorney with 2-4 years of experience in criminal defense. Jury trial experience is a must. Applicant will be working primarily in the Sarasota/Bradenton offices but must be willing to travel to offices in Tampa, and Clearwater/St. Petersburg. Salary depends on experience and performance, $150K+.
Check out our website: www.criminalattorneytampa.net
Instagram: @hanlonlawfirm
Job Type: Full-time

Labor & Employment Attorney/Lawyer
Marble is a human kind of law firm that combines remarkable legal care, transparency, and heart. By using predictive analytics to accurately price and predict each legal need, a collaboration platform for a faster and optimal case result, and digital communications, Marble makes the experience of getting quality legal care easy and affordable. Marble set out to make legal care more accessible for everyday people by building technology that empowers attorneys to do their best work, and that puts clients in control of the process from start to finish.
We are a fast-growing early-stage startup founded by a team of serial entrepreneurs and is backed by Silicon Valley VC funds.
Marble is looking for a licensed Attorney/Lawyer to begin taking Labor & Employment cases as co-counsel immediately, fully remote.

Job Title: Plaintiff Personal Injury Attorney Positions – Litigation / Trial LA
Job Description:
Plaintiff Personal Injury Attorney Positions – Litigation / Trial
HEIDARI LAW GROUP, P.C., is one of the fastest growing and successful Plaintiff's Personal Injury law firms in California and Nevada, with principal offices in Los Angeles and Las Vegas, but additional offices throughout both states. We have a growing reputation and the respect of adversaries in our ethical but firm representation of our clients’ interests.
We currently have two litigation attorney and one trial attorney to add to our growing team of four lawyers in Los Angeles, California. We are looking for enthusiastic candidates eager to take ownership of his/her own cases and who is not afraid of gaining trial experience. Unlike other firms, we pride ourselves on taking our cases from intake and up and through to trial, if necessary, which provides our employees and candidates the perfect opportunities to gain extensive trial, litigation, and negotiation experience. The ideal candidate will be comfortable handling all aspects of litigation from pre-litigation filings and discovery to mediations, arbitrations, and including jury trials, if necessary. Our attorneys are always supported by an excellent staff of paralegals and legal assistants to ensure that a positive work environment keeps all employees working as a team.

Maaswinkel Law is a small plaintiff’s personal injury and worker compensation law firm located near downtown Orlando, Florida. We are looking for an associate with 3 to 5 years of litigation experience and in good standing with the Florida Bar. Defense experience preferred. Must have tried at least 3 jury trials. The candidate must be a “people person” that understands how to effectively communicate with clients of varying degrees of education and sophistication. The candidate must be personable, compassionate, and empathetic towards people that are injured. If it is not in your nature to promptly return phone calls, text messages, and emails, this position is not for you. The candidate will be expected to manage assigned cases from intake, presuit, litigation, trial, and appeal if necessary. Excellent opportunity for an ambitious person.
Compensation includes base salary, bonuses, paid bar dues, paid membership to FJA and CFTLA, retirement benefits, health insurance, and paid time off.
Job Type: Full-time

Segal McCambridge, a national litigation firm, is seeking an Associate Attorney for our Chicago office. The primary focus will be on commercial litigation (contract disputes, fraud, UCC, statutory violations, and business torts), intellectual property litigation, product liability, professional liability, life sciences, employment law, and technology and cybersecurity matters. The attorney holding this position is responsible for managing case files, legal research, preparing legal documents, investigating facts, and attending hearings, depositions, and trials.
Qualified candidates must have 2-4 years of relevant legal experience, strong academic credentials, excellent writing and research skills, and proven ability to analyze sophisticated and complex factual and legal issues. They need to be a self-starter with the ability to work independently on smaller matters, but also within a team structure on larger ones. Courtroom, motion, and deposition experience required, and trial experience preferred. Experience in state and federal courts and with alternative dispute resolution is also desirable.

Burford & Ryburn, L.L.P. is seeking an energetic and dedicated associate attorney with 1 – 3 years of experience in civil defense litigation to join our law firm team. You’ll work on a variety of cases and ensure the needs of our clients are always placed as our top priority.
Associate Attorney Responsibilities
Draft motions and prepare reports
Manage designated litigation caseload
Review client documents and claim files in preparation for deadlines
Participate in court appearances and depositions
Communicate with clients and provide status reports

Job Description:
Plaintiff Personal Injury Attorney Positions – Litigation / Trial
HEIDARI LAW GROUP, P.C., is one of the fastest growing and successful Plaintiff's Personal Injury law firms in California and Nevada, with principal offices in Los Angeles and Las Vegas, but additional offices throughout both states. We have a growing reputation and the respect of adversaries in our ethical but firm representation of our clients’ interests.
We currently have two litigation attorney and one trial attorney to add to our growing team of four lawyers in Los Angeles, California. We are looking for enthusiastic candidates eager to take ownership of his/her own cases and who is not afraid of gaining trial experience. Unlike other firms, we pride ourselves on taking our cases from intake and up and through to trial, if necessary, which provides our employees and candidates the perfect opportunities to gain extensive trial, litigation, and negotiation experience. The ideal candidate will be comfortable handling all aspects of litigation from pre-litigation filings and discovery to mediations, arbitrations, and including jury trials, if necessary. Our attorneys are always supported by an excellent staff of paralegals and legal assistants to ensure that a positive work environment keeps all employees working as a team.

The candidate must be a “people person” that understands how to effectively communicate with clients of varying degrees of education and sophistication. The candidate must be personable, compassionate, and empathetic towards people that are injured. If it is not in your nature to promptly return phone calls, text messages, and emails, this position is not for you. The candidate will be expected to manage assigned cases from intake, presuit, litigation, trial, and appeal if necessary. Excellent opportunity for an ambitious person.
Compensation includes base salary, bonuses, paid bar dues, paid membership to FJA and CFTLA, retirement benefits, health insurance, and paid time off.
